info.name: Basal ganglia
info.description: Basal ganglia refers to a group of subcortical nuclei that includes the corpus striatum (caudate nucleus + putamen), globus pallidus, substantia nigra and subthalamic nucleus. They have strong interconnections with the cerebral cortex and are involved with diverse motor, cognitive and emotional functions.  Note:  This is one of the unusual examples when the term 'ganglia' is used for a central nervous system structure; more commonly, the term 'ganglion' or 'ganglia' refers to a collection of nerve cell bodies in the peripheral nervous system.
